citation.article-title: Caminicella sporogenes gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel thermophilic spore-forming bacterium isolated from an East-Pacific Rise hydrothermal vent.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Caminicella (Ca.mi'ni.cel'la. L. gen. n. camini of a chimney, relating to the hydrothermal chimney origin ; L. fem. n. cella cell ; N.L. fem. n. caminicella cell from a hydrothermal chimney)
Cells are rod-shaped, motile, and stain Gram-negative.
Spore-forming thermophile, adapted to the pH and salinity of the ocean.
Anaerobic and heterotrophic; able to ferment proteinaceous substrates and carbohydrates.
16S rDNA sequence comparisons locate the Caminicella genus in the domain Bacteria, within cluster XI of the lineage encompassing the genus Clostridium and related genera (Collins et al., 1994).
